content.question: The graph of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, shown above, consists of three line segments. What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="negative 1 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
